solution_line_template: So there is ${cost_per_group_no_discount} x {discount_percentage} = $<<{cost_per_group_no_discount}*{discount_percentage}={discount_amount_per_group}>>{discount_amount_per_group} discount for each {seats_in_group} seats purchased.

Thus, the total cost for every {seats_in_group} seats is ${cost_per_group_no_discount} - ${discount_amount_per_group} = $<<{cost_per_group_no_discount}-{discount_amount_per_group}={cost_per_group_with_discount}>>{cost_per_group_with_discount}.
The school is going to buy {num_rows} x {seats_per_row} = <<{num_rows}*{seats_per_row}={total_seats_to_buy}>>{total_seats_to_buy} seats.
This means that the school is going to buy {total_seats_to_buy}/{seats_in_group} = <<{total_seats_to_buy}/{seats_in_group}={num_groups_of_seats}>>{num_groups_of_seats} sets of {seats_in_group} seats.

Therefore, the school will pay a total of ${cost_per_group_with_discount} x {num_groups_of_seats} = $<<{cost_per_group_with_discount}*{num_groups_of_seats}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} for the new seats
